title: Tex-Mex Turkey Soup

ingredients.content: 4 corn tortillas, cut into strips  (¼ in. x 1 in.)
8 sprigs cilantro, leaves and tender stems
1 tbsp fajita seasoning, homemade or packaged
8 oz turkey cutlet, cut into pieces (1 in.)
4 oz canned black beans, rinsed, drained
1 lime, cut into small wedges, to garnish

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Place tortilla strips on a baking sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes (350°F) or until golden brown. Set aside and allow to cool. Place cheddar cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place cilantro into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, fajita seasoning and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>, then cook <b>6 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.
Add tomato paste, turkey broth and salt, place Varoma into position, weigh in turkey, secure Varoma lid and steam <b>20 min/212°F/speed 1<b>. Remove Varoma dish and place onto inverted Varoma lid.
Add corn, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook <b>6 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.
Divide black beans, tomatoes, turkey and soup into serving bowls.
Garnish with avocado, reserved chopped cilantro, sour cream, reserved cheese, lime and reserved tortilla strips. Serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: For a quick version use leftover cooked turkey and reduce steaming time to 5 minutes.
Use the fajita seasoning recipe from the Tex-Mex Cookbook or use a store-bought version.
